column5: St. Edmund, King of East Anglia, was captured by the Danes in 870 after refusing to renounce his Christian faith. He was tied to an oak tree, beaten, shot with arrows, and beheadedâ€”his head later miraculously found guarded by a wolf.
It is said that this was St. Levan's favourite seat; and one day cracked it in two with a blow from his staff and uttered a prophecy.
